title: Seeing Lazarus in Our Midst
prompts: A moment when I noticed someone others ignored
Someone in my life right now who might feel like Lazarus at the gate
What gets in the way of me noticing people in need?
If Jesus told this story in NYC today, what details might He use?
One small way I can 'cross the gate' this week and notice someone
One habit I could let go of that keeps me from seeing others
A ministry, charity, or effort I admire that is 'feeding Lazarus' (doesn't have to be the Bread of Life food pantry!)
